text: The Song of Moses
“Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak,
and let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
May my teaching trickle like the dew,
my words like rain showers on tender grass,
and like spring showers on new growth.
For I will proclaim the name of Yahweh;
ascribe greatness to our God!
The Rock, his work \add is\add* perfect,
for all his ways \add are\add* just;
\add he is\add* a faithful God, and ⸤without injustice⸥;\f + \fr 32:4 \ft Literally “there is not injustice” \f*
righteous and upright \add is\add* he.
They \add have\add* behaved corruptly toward\f + \fr 32:5 \ft Or “with” \f* him;
\add they are\add* not his children; \add this is\add* their flaw,
a generation crooked and perverse.
\add Like\add* this do you treat Yahweh,
foolish and ⸤unwise⸥\f + \fr 32:6 \ft Literally “not wise” \f* people?
\add Has\add* he not, your father, created you?
He made you, and he established you.
Remember \add the\add* old days, ⸤the years long past⸥;\f + \fr 32:7 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft years of \fq from \ft generation to generation” \f*
ask your father, and he will inform you,
your elders and they will tell you.\f + \fr 32:7 \ft Hebrew “to you” \f*
⸤When the Most High apportioned⸥\f + \fr 32:8 \ft Literally “In/at the apportioning of the Most High” \f* \add the\add* nations,
at his dividing \add up\add* of the sons of humankind,
he fixed the boundaries of \add the\add* peoples,
according to the number of the children of Israel.\f + \fr 32:8 \ft LXX reads “the number of the angels of God”; Dead Sea Scrolls reads “the number of the sons of God” \f*
For Yahweh’s portion \add was\add* his people,
Jacob the share of his inheritance.
He found him in a desert land,
and in a howling, desert wasteland;
he ⸤encircled him⸥,\f + \fr 32:10 \ft Literally “moved around him” \f* he cared for him,
he protected him like the ⸤apple⸥\f + \fr 32:10 \ft Literally “pupil” \f* of his eye.
As an eagle stirs up its nest,
hovers over its young,
spreads out its wings, takes them,\f + \fr 32:11 \ft Hebrew “it” but used poetically and with plural sense in context \f*
carries them\f + \fr 32:11 \ft Hebrew “it” but used poetically and with plural sense in context \f* on its pinions,\f + \fr 32:11 \ft Hebrew “pinion” \f*
\add so\add* Yahweh alone guided him,\f + \fr 32:12 \ft That is, Jacob, standing for Israel \f*
and ⸤there was no foreign god accompanying him⸥.\f + \fr 32:12 \ft Literally “and there was not with him a god foreign/strange” \f*
And he set him on the high places of \add the\add* land,
and he fed \add him\add* the crops\f + \fr 32:13 \ft Hebrew “crop” \f* of \add the\add* field,
and he nursed him with honey from crags,\f + \fr 32:13 \ft Hebrew “crag” \f*
and \add with\add* oil from flinty rock,
\add With\add* curds\f + \fr 32:14 \ft Hebrew “curd” \f* from \add the\add* herd,
and \add with\add* milk from \add the\add* flock,
with \add the\add* fat of young rams,
and rams, the offspring of Bashan,
and with goats \add along\add* with the finest kernels of wheat,

and \add from\add* the blood of grapes\f + \fr 32:14 \ft Hebrew “grape” \f* you drank fermented wine.\f + \fr 32:14 \ft Or “partially fermented wine”; others translate simply as wine (NASB, NEB); HALOT 330, “still fermenting wine” \f*
And Jeshurun grew fat, and he kicked;
you grew fat, you bloated, and you became obstinate;
and he abandoned God, his maker,
and he scoffed \add at\add* the rock of his salvation.
They made him jealous with strange \add gods\add*;
with detestable things they provoked him.
They sacrificed to the demons, not God,
\add to\add* gods whom\f + \fr 32:17 \ft Hebrew “them” \f* they had not known,
new \add gods\add* \add who\add*\f + \fr 32:17 \ft Hebrew “they,” understood in the verb form \f* came from recent times;
⸤their ancestors had not known them⸥.\f + \fr 32:17 \ft Literally “their fathers not knew them” \f*
\add The\add* rock who\f + \fr 32:18 \ft Hebrew “he,” understood in verb form \f* bore you, you neglected,
and you forgot God, \add the one\add* giving you birth.
Then Yahweh saw, and he spurned \add them\add*,
because of the provocation of his sons and his daughters.
So he said, ‘I will hide my face from them;
I will see what \add will be\add* their end,
for they \add are\add* a generation of perversity,
⸤children in whom there is no faithfulness⸥.\f + \fr 32:20 \ft Literally “sons not faithfulness \fq is \ft in them” \f*
They annoyed me with \add what is\add* not a god;
they provoked me with their idols.
So I will make them jealous with \add those\add* not a people,
with a foolish nation I will provoke them.
For a fire was kindled\f + \fr 32:22 \ft Or “ignited” \f* by my anger,
and it burned ⸤up to the depths of Sheol⸥,\f + \fr 32:22 \ft Literally “up to Sheol depths” \f*
and it devoured \add the\add* earth and its produce,
and it set afire the foundation of \add the\add* mountains.
I will heap disasters upon them;
my arrows I will spend on them.
\add They will become\add* weakened by famine,
and consumed by plague and bitter pestilence;
and the teeth of wild animals I will send against them,
with \add the\add* poison of \add the\add* creeping \add things\add* in \add the\add* dust;
From outside \add her boundaries\add* the sword will make \add her\add* childless,
and from inside, terror;
both \add for\add* \add the\add* young man \add and\add* also the young woman,
the infant \add along with\add* the gray-headed man.
I thought, “I will wipe them out;
⸤I will make people forget they ever existed⸥.”\f + \fr 32:26 \ft Literally “I will blot out from among human being their remembrance” \f*
If I had not feared a provocation of \add the\add* enemy,
lest their foes might misunderstand, \f + \fr 32:27 \ft Or “so that they not make a false construal” of what has happened \f*
lest they should say, \f + \fr 32:27 \ft Or “so that they might not” \f* “Our hand is
⸤triumphant⸥,\f + \fr 32:27 \ft Literally “raised/held high” \f* and Yahweh \add did\add* not do all this.” ’
For ⸤they are a nation void of sense⸥,\f + \fr 32:28 \ft Literally “they a nation perishing of counsel” \f*
and there is not \add any\add* understanding in them.
If only they were wise, they would understand this;
they would discern ⸤for themselves their end⸥.\f + \fr 32:29 \ft Literally “they would discern for end their” \f*
How could one chase a thousand
and two could cause a myriad to flee,
if their Rock had not sold them,
and Yahweh had \add not\add* given them up?
For the fact of the matter is,
their rock \add is\add* not like our Rock,

and our enemies recognize\f + \fr 32:31 \ft The meaning of this expression is uncertain, but “discerns” or “judges” seem good choices; see HALOT 932, which allows for “judges” or “in the estimation of our enemies” \f* \add this\add*.
For their vine \add is\add* from the vine of Sodom,
and from the terraces of Gomorrah;
their grapes \add are\add* grapes of poison;
⸤their clusters are bitter⸥.\f + \fr 32:32 \ft Literally “clusters of bitter \fq are \ft for them” \f*
Their wine \add is\add* the poison of snakes,
and \add the\add* deadly poison of horned vipers.
‘\add Is\add* not this stored up with me,
sealed in my treasuries?’\f + \fr 32:34 \ft Or “storehouses \f*
⸤Vengeance belongs to me⸥\f + \fr 32:35 \ft Literally “To me \fq is \ft vengeance” \f* and \add also\add* recompense,
⸤for at the time their foot slips⸥,\f + \fr 32:35 \ft Literally “at \fq the \ft time \fq when \ft it shall slip foot their” \f*
because the day of their disaster \add is\add* near,
⸤and fate comes quickly for them⸥.’\f + \fr 32:35 \ft Literally “and comes quickly/hurries events to come to them” \f*
For Yahweh will judge \add on behalf of\add* his people,
and concerning his servants;
he will change his mind when he sees that \add their\add* power has disappeared,
and \add there is\add* no one left, confined\f + \fr 32:36 \ft Or “bond/bound” \f* or free.\f + \fr 32:36 \ft Or “freed” \f*
And he will say, ‘Where \add are\add* their gods,
\add their\add* rock in whom\f + \fr 32:37 \ft Hebrew “in him” \f* they took refuge?
Who ate the fat of their sacrifices
\add and\add* drank the wine of their libations?
Let them rise \add up\add*, and let them help you;
⸤Let them be to you a refuge⸥.\f + \fr 32:38 \ft Literally “let there be/him/them unto you \fq as \ft a shelter” \f*
See, now, that I, \add even\add* I \add am\add* he,
and there is not a god besides me;
I put to death and I give life;
I wound and I heal;
there is not \add one\add* who delivers from my hand!
For \add indeed\add* I lift up my hand to heaven,
And I promise ⸤as I live forever⸥,\f + \fr 32:40 \ft Literally “live I to eternity” \f*
When I sharpen\f + \fr 32:41 \ft Or “have sharpened” \f* ⸤my flashing sword⸥,\f + \fr 32:41 \ft Literally “the flashing of my sword” \f*
and my hand takes hold\f + \fr 32:41 \ft Or “seizes” \f* \add of it\add* in judgment,
⸤I will take reprisals against my foes⸥,\f + \fr 32:41 \ft Literally “I will let return vengeance to foes my” \f*
and my haters I will repay.
I will make my arrows drunk with blood,
and my sword shall devour flesh with the blood of the slain,
and captives\f + \fr 32:42 \ft Hebrew “captive” \f* from the heads\f + \fr 32:42 \ft Hebrew “head” \f* of the leaders of \add the\add* enemy.’
Call for songs of joy, O nations, \add concerning\add* his people,\f + \fr 32:43 \ft Dead Sea Scrolls reads: “Rejoice, O heavenly ones, with him! Bow down, all you gods, before him!” \f*
for the blood of his servants he will avenge,
⸤and he will take reprisals against his foes⸥,\f + \fr 32:43 \ft Literally “vengeance he will let return to his foes” \f*
and he will make atonement \add for\add* his land, his people.”
And Moses came, and he spoke\f + \fr 32:44 \ft Or “recited” \f* all the words of this song in the ears of the people; \add that is\add*, he and Joshua the son of Nun.
⸤And when Moses finished speaking⸥\f + \fr 32:45 \ft Literally “And \fq he \ft finished Moses to speak” \f* all these words to all Israel,

then he said to them, “⸤Take to heart all the words⸥\f + \fr 32:46 \ft Literally “Put heart your to all the words” \f* that I \add am\add* admonishing \add against\add* you ⸤today⸥\f + \fr 32:46 \ft Literally “the day” \f* \add concerning\add* which you should instruct them \add with respect to\add* your children\f + \fr 32:46 \ft Or “sons” \f* ⸤so that they will observe diligently⸥\f + \fr 32:46 \ft Literally “to keep to do” \f* all the words of this law,

for it \add is\add* not a trifling matter among you, but it \add is\add* your life, and through this word ⸤you will live long in the land⸥\f + \fr 32:47 \ft Literally “you will make long days on the land” \f* that you \add are about\add* to cross the Jordan \add to get\add* there to take possession of it.”
Instructions Concerning Moses’ Death
And Yahweh said to Moses on exactly this day, ⸤saying⸥,\f + \fr 32:48 \ft Literally “to say” \f*

“Go up to this mountain of the Abarim \add range\add*, Mount Nebo, which \add is\add* ⸤opposite Jericho⸥,\f + \fr 32:49 \ft Literally “on the face of Jericho” \f* and see the land of Canaan that I \add am\add* giving to the ⸤Israelites⸥\f + \fr 32:49 \ft Literally “sons/children of Israel” \f* as \add a\add* possession.

You shall die on that mountain that you \add are\add* about to go up there, and \add you will\add* be gathered to your people, \add just\add* as your brother Aaron died on ⸤Mount Hor⸥\f + \fr 32:50 \ft Literally “on Hor the mountain” \f* and he was gathered to his people,

because \add of the fact\add* that you broke faith with me in the midst of Israel at the waters of Meribah Kadesh, \add in\add* the desert of Zin, because ⸤you did not treat me as holy⸥\f + \fr 32:51 \ft Literally “that not you treated me as holy” \f* in the midst of the ⸤Israelites⸥.\f + \fr 32:51 \ft Literally “sons/children of Israel” \f*

Yes, from afar you may view the land, but there you shall not enter there, \add that is\add*, into the land that I \add am\add* giving to the ⸤Israelites⸥.”\f + \fr 32:52 \ft Literally “sons/children of Israel” \f*
